content.description: Fun slab climb with 4 bolts and some holes for tri-cams. Bolted belay station at top. Double rope rappel.
content.location: West of a large patch of red rock, scramble up to a wide sloping ledge.

content.description:
Pitch 1 (10a): This is a wonderful warm-up slab pitch for what's to come. Supplement the bolts with gear, and climb through a short slab crux to a roof with a reachy clip and a reachier mantle up onto two... warm black knobs.

Pitch 2 (7/8): A quick "getting there" pitch with easier friction & edges to a bolted anchor.

Pitch 3 (10c): The leader will have to earn every bolt on this pitch, which is steep, thin, and continuous up to another reachy roof move. The roof is followed by two more bolts of easier friction to a bolted anchor.

Pitch 4 (mungey 5th): The topo says "3rd class off" after the 3rd pitch, but unless we missed it, I'd recommend using a rope through the final ledges to the top.

Detailed topo, route beta, and area info are in the guide to the Courtright area by

Dwight Kroll

.
content.protection: Minimum 8 draws for bolts, plus a light single rack from about .2 through 2".
content.location:
East face of Power Dome (opposite the creek), right of

Don't Go Changin'

(10b) and left of Kelsey's Klimb (10c).

content.description: "Several unusual short vertical cracks/grooves (vertical smiles) and a line of eight bolts leading up to a roof at the top. A highly recommended climb requiring good technique and some unusual moves."
content.protection: 8 bolts. Pro to 1.5. The vertical seams might have a piece or two, but flakes between bolts 7 and 8 have pro potential. Rap rings.
content.location: Furthest left bolted route on the east side of Power Dome.

content.description: This route looks great, but is highly vegetated and needs maintenance. Didn't have the right tools for the job, but will return to get my hands dirty. Large appealing left facing, left trending corner to overhang roof. Anchor bolts above looked good from the Giving Spencer Tracy belay.
content.location: Prominent roof feature. Use the large pine tree below to reference. Right of Giving Spencer Tracy.

content.description: Climb the right facing and slightly overhung corner. Work up the corner until it is possible to move right and clip the final bolt on "Vertical Smile," then pull through the roof to the anchor.
content.protection: Micro Cams to 2.5" and one bolt.
content.location: Left most route on the Zebra Wall/East Face of Power Dome.

content.description: Thin left facing flake on the right side of the black streak with two bolts near the ground. Bolted rappel.

"This climb begins on thin stuff (.10a move) protected by two bolts and proceeds through a quality .8 section." After the 5th bolt the route splits. Right is better. Both left and right options have a single bolt and holes for tricams.
content.protection: 6 bolts, holes for tricams, bolted anchors and rap rings.
content.location: The right-most of three bolted lines around the corner to the left of the red/orange rock patches.

content.description: Fun slab climb with some holes for tri-cams.
content.location: Scramble up to a wide sloping ledge just west of a large red rock face.

content.description: Climb the long black streak past multiple cruxes. Skid Mark is a long route and required two ropes to descend.
content.location: East face of Power Dome between Racing Stripes and In The Black.

climbs.name: The man who has climbed everything

content.description: Ted was bored, so climbed a new route to the right of Prather Girl Paradise, shares an anchor with that route.
content.location: Directly to the right of "Prather Girl Paradise" head up and back to the anchor of PGP

content.description:
We only climbed P1. The topo lists 8 bolts for 165'. There are only 6, with supplemental gear in a small crack feature above the mini-roof. Requisite 5.8 friction on run out terrain.

P1: 5.8

P2: 5.10c
content.protection: 6 bolts with placements for a good #2 in the crescent feature mid way up P1. P2 topo lists 6 bolts. Need two ropes to rap P1.
content.location: Right of "Warm Black Knobs". Furthest right bolt line that we saw on the east side of Power Dome.

climbs.name: Into Thin Hair
climbs.fa: Dwight Kroll, Barry Chambers, Leni Reeves, 2004

content.description:
P1: climb 4th class up the grey rock bordering the orange rock (can rope up and place gear), belay on large ledge.

P2: start up a large hollow flake, then slab above, clipping bolts, passing the crux, then ledges until at a 2 bolt belay immediately right of a right-facing corner.

P3: climb up corner until it starts trending right (careful of a loose death flake here), look for a series of bolts above (next to some knobs), escape out of and over the corner/roof, heading up the bolt line, past various ledges, arriving at bolted anchor.

P4: short pitch of low 5th to top (gear belay).

perhaps one move of 5.9, rest is easier. poor rock quality, loose flakes, hollow flakes that you wouldn't want to whip on.
content.location: immediately right of the red rock patch on the south east face of Power Dome. just right of Divorce Quartz and Spray the Baby, which pass through the grey rock bands that transect the orange rock. see photo.

content.description:
This description is for the first pitch only. This route can be completed to the top of Power Dome in 2 or 3 pitches although the second pitch is dangerously runout.

"Classic first pitch and birthplace of the "Spencer Tracy" belay technique" For more information on this belay technique buy the Kroll guidebook for Courtright Reservoir. It is spectacular and loaded with interesting information.
content.protection: 8 Bolts. Cams to 3" to supplement. Bolted anchors with rap rings at first belay ledge. Two ropes required.
content.location: Bolted slab face to the left of the leftward arching corner of Time is a Story Teller (5.8)

content.description: Good route overall. Route Finding is a bit difficult. Following the Cliff Notes, the first belay is tough to find, and the route to the second belay is not obvious. The path we took felt like Yosemite 5.10a on one section.
content.protection: Gear belays, a few bolts, mostly cam and nut placements, single rack was adequate, 70M rope helped.
content.location: Southeast face, obvious start is on the gray granite strip running through red granite.

climbs.name: C'mon Now
climbs.fa: Dwight Kroll, Barry Chambers, & John Vargas (July 2010)

content.description:
Pitch 1 (5.10a, bolts + pro): Easy face and slab climbing up to a high first bolt. Floow a left trending seam through a few bolts. The seam opens up to accept pro and leads to a bolted anchor.

Pitch 2 (5.8, all bolts): Moderate slab climbing straight up the face through a series of bolts. Pitch ends at a bolted bleay.

Pitch 3 (5.10b, bolts + pro): Pull the roof or climb around it to the left, up to a right trending flake system. This leads to a short slab head wall through two bolts, with the crux between the bolts. Continue up moderate face and slab climbing over featured rock up to your choice of natural anchor position (lots of options).

Pitch 4 (5.6, all pro): Climb up to the roof system near the top of the dome and find the weakness to the summit.
content.protection: Cams 0.2" - 2.0", nuts, 10 draws (some alpine for route wandering)
content.location: This route is immediately left of Don't Go Changin'. The left trending seam on pitch 1 is visible from the ground

content.description:
Pitch 1 (5.9, 5 bolts + pro): Nice friction slab with occasional edges for hands. Belay at a 2 bolt anchor.

Pitch 2 (5.7, 3 bolts): Fun "get there" pitch. Belay at a 2 bolt anchor on the side of the right-facing feature.

Pitch 3 (5.10b, 7 bolts + pro): Tricky moves on gear through the right facing feature.  Pull over the roof to a series of bolt protected faces and ledges.  Belay at a 2 bolt anchor.

Pitch 4 (5.6, 3 bolts + pro): Another "get there" pitch with good runouts on easy terrain.  Gear belay between a giant block and the head wall.

Topo says "3rd class" from here, but we stayed roped up and did a 4th/5th class traverse to climbers left to get around mungy vertical terrain

Detailed topo, route beta, and area info will be in the upcoming guide to the Courtright area by

Dwight Kroll

.
content.location:
East face of Power Dome (opposite the creek), 2 routes left of

Warm Black Knobs

content.description:
"Hardest moves at the base. Bring tricams to protect intermediate bunghole territory"

Two hardest moves at base, easy protection with tricams.
